title: A97-1020

sentences.text: GLOSSER is designed to support reading and learning to read in a foreign language .
There are four language pairs currently supported by GLOSSER : English-Bulgarian , English-Estonian , English-Hungarian and French-Dutch .
The program is operational on UNIX and Windows '95 platforms , and has undergone a pilot user-study .

A demonstration -LRB- in UNIX -RRB- for Applied Natural Language Processing emphasizes components put to novel technical uses in intelligent computer-assisted morphological analysis -LRB- ICALL -RRB- , including disambiguated morphological analysis and lemmatized indexing for an aligned bilingual corpus of word examples .

Entity-glosser.label: GLOSSER
Entity-glosser.description: A computer program or software that supports reading and learning to read in a foreign language, with features such as disambiguated morphological analysis and lemmatized indexing for an aligned bilingual corpus of word examples.

Entity-the_program.label: The program
Entity-the_program.description: A software application designed to support reading and learning to read in a foreign language, currently operational on UNIX and Windows '95 platforms.

Entity--lrb-_icall_-rrb-.label: -LRB- ICALL -RRB-
Entity--lrb-_icall_-rrb-.description: A computer-assisted morphological analysis system that uses intelligent techniques to analyze and index a bilingual corpus.

Entity-icall.label: ICALL
Entity-icall.description: ICALL: a computer-assisted language learning system that emphasizes intelligent morphological analysis, including disambiguated and lemmatized indexing for an aligned bilingual corpus of word examples.

Entity-a_pilot_user-study.label: a pilot user-study
Entity-a_pilot_user-study.description: A small-scale experiment or investigation conducted to test and evaluate the usability of GLOSSER before its full implementation.

Entity-english-hungarian.label: English-Hungarian
Entity-english-hungarian.description: A language pair consisting of Hungarian and English languages used for translation purposes.

Entity-english-bulgarian.label: English-Bulgarian
Entity-english-bulgarian.description: A language pair used for translation between English and Bulgarian languages.

Entity--lrb-.label: -LRB-
Entity--lrb-.description: A demonstration or presentation in UNIX for Applied Natural Language Processing

Entity-a_demonstration.label: A demonstration
Entity-a_demonstration.description: A demonstration of novel technical uses of intelligent computer-assisted morphological analysis components, including disambiguated morphological analysis and lemmatized indexing for an aligned bilingual corpus of word examples.

Entity-including_disambiguated_morpholog.label: including disambiguated morphological analysis and lemmatized indexing for an aligned bilingual corpus of word examples
aliases: including disambiguated morphological analysis and lemmatized indexing for an aligned bilingual corpus of word examples
Entity-including_disambiguated_morpholog.description: A methodology that combines disambiguated morphological analysis with lemmatized indexing to facilitate searching and retrieval within a bilingual corpus of word examples, where words are aligned across two languages.

mentions.local_name: including disambiguated morphological analysis and lemmatized indexing for an aligned bilingual corpus of word examples

Entity-aligned_bilingual_corpus_of_word_.label: aligned bilingual corpus of word examples
aliases: aligned bilingual corpus of word examples
types: resource for language learning and research
Entity-aligned_bilingual_corpus_of_word_.description: A collection of paired linguistic examples from two languages, used to facilitate language learning and research.

mentions.local_name: aligned bilingual corpus of word examples
local_types: resource for language learning and research

Entity-reading_and_learning_to_read_in_a.label: reading and learning to read in a foreign language
aliases: reading and learning to read in a foreign language
Entity-reading_and_learning_to_read_in_a.description: The process of acquiring literacy skills in a non-native language.

mentions.local_name: reading and learning to read in a foreign language

Entity-french-dutch.label: French-Dutch
Entity-french-dutch.description: A language pair consisting of French and Dutch languages used for translation purposes.

Entity-applied_natural_language_processi.label: Applied Natural Language Processing
Entity-applied_natural_language_processi.description: The application of computational techniques to analyze, understand, and generate human language.

Entity-lemmatized_indexing.label: lemmatized indexing
Entity-lemmatized_indexing.description: The process of creating a lexical index that maps words to their base or dictionary form, used in intelligent computer-assisted morphological analysis for an aligned bilingual corpus.

Entity-morphological_analysis.label: morphological analysis
Entity-morphological_analysis.description: The process or task of analyzing words to identify their constituent parts, such as roots, prefixes, and suffixes.

Entity-unix.label: UNIX
Entity-unix.description: A popular open-source operating system and platform

Entity-unix_and_window_95_platform.label: UNIX and Windows '95 platforms
Entity-unix_and_window_95_platform.description: A set of operating systems that includes both Unix-based and Microsoft Windows '95 versions.

Entity-program.label: program
Entity-program.description: A software application or system designed to perform specific tasks or operations.

Entity-pilot_user-study.label: pilot user-study
Entity-pilot_user-study.description: A preliminary investigation or experiment conducted with human participants to test and refine research methods.

Entity-window_95.label: Windows '95
Entity-window_95.description: A version of the Microsoft Windows operating system released in 1995.

summary: GLOSSER is designed to support reading and learning to read in a foreign language . There are four language pairs currently supported by GLOSSER : English-Bulgarian , English-Estonian , English-Hungarian and French-Dutch . The program is operational on UNIX and Windows '95 platforms , and has undergone a pilot user-study . A demonstration -LRB- in UNIX -RRB- for Applied Natural Language Processing emphasizes components put to novel technical uses in intelligent computer-assisted morphological analysis -LRB- ICALL -RRB- , including disambiguated morphological analysis and lemmatized indexing for an aligned bilingual corpus of word examples .

Predicate-support.label: support
Predicate-support.description: To support means to provide assistance or resources that enable someone or something to achieve their goals, overcome challenges, or maintain stability. In this sense, it connects the subject (the entity providing support) with the object (the activity, process, or state being supported), indicating a relationship of facilitation, empowerment, or sustenance.

Predicate-supports.label: supports
Predicate-supports.description: The predicate 'supports' indicates a relationship where the subject provides sustenance or backing to the object. This can be interpreted as offering resources, assistance, or validation that enables the object's existence, development, or functionality.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is related to or encompasses the object as a more general concept. This relationship suggests that the subject provides context, scope, or category for the object.
